locks.name: Green Pirates Shaft Red Lock (to Statues Hallway)

enemies.note: They're really between 2 and 4, but they are the actual obstacle between the two, so access to either + ability to kill them is enough to get their drops.

strats.name: Xray Climb
note: Climb until the camera fully shows Samus on the bottom of the screen.  Shoot up to clear the shot blocks and resume climbing until you can walk out to the left.
Fix the camera by shooting the floor shot block and jumping down.

strats.name: Xray Climb
note: Xray climb 2 screen lengths and until the camera shows Samus' helmet on the bottom of the screen.
Shoot up to clear the shot blocks and resume climbing until you can walk out to the right.
Fix the camera by shooting the floor shot block and jumping down.
The pirate will attack while climbing past it.

strats.name: Xray Climb
note: Xray climb 2 screen lengths and until the camera shows Samus' helmet on the bottom of the screen.
Shoot up to clear the shot blocks and resume climbing until you can walk out to the left.
Fix the camera by shooting the floor shot block and jumping down.
The pirate will attack while climbing past it.

strats.name: Green Pirate Shaft Beetom Xray Climb
note: Shoot out only the lower 2 shot blocks on the side Samus will be climbing.
Grab a Beetom and use Morph to pixel align the Beetom with the edge of the wall.  While facing right.
Xray stand up for height and shoot to freeze.  Angle down shot to be safe.  Continue refreezing during the next steps.
Grab the other Beetom and stand close, but not too close, to the first.
Do a small jump, but not too low, and do an angle down shot the frame before Samus lands.
This second beetom needs to be exactly 1 pixel below the first.  Refreeze the first before testing the positioning.
Jump onto your beetom, walk into the wall, and start xray Climbing.
Climb up 2.5 screens and then fire upwards to clear shot blocks.  Continue climbing and finish by walking away from the crumble blocks.
devNote: 5 hits to position the two beetoms.  1 hit for each failed clip attempt, 20 attempts.
One could descend through 8 visiting one of 5 or 6 and xray climb back up to the top door using the non visited node.

nodes.name: Statues Event
nodes.note: Represents the statues actually sinking and opening up the path to Tourian

nodes.name: Underwater Statues Event
nodes.note: Represents the statues actually sinking and opening up the path to Tourian, but coming from below

to.note: The path to the node is considered clear, but the node itself must be unlocked to actually cross below
The path to the node is considered clear, and the event can trigger coming up from the elevator, but the node itself must be unlocked to actually cross above

strats.name: Shinespark
strats.note: Jump to either side and diagonal spark out.

note: If Tourian is locked, coming in from below results in glitched graphics.
You can reach the elevator to go back down again or sit through the unlock to get up which in turn can result in persisting glitched graphics.

runways.name: Base Runway - Gauntlet Entrance Left Door (to E-Tank)

strats.name: Yapping Maw Alive
note: It is possible to run through the Yapping Maw while it is attacking a different direction.
But that likely requires acid damage and isn't entirely reliable.

strats.name: Yapping Maw Frozen
strats.note: Freeze the Yapping Maw while it is in the air, extended.

nodes.name: Gauntlet Entrance Right Door (to Landing Site)

runways.name: Base Runway - Gauntlet Entrance Right Door (to Landing Site)

strats.name: Yapping Maw Alive
strats.devNote: The yapping maw prevents use of an extra runway tile because it will move to grab Samus

strats.name: Gauntlet Entrance Shinecharge Under Yapping Maw
note: Jump towards the yapping maw before it is on screen so it moves up.
Quickly move it off camera so it will be `frozen` in place.
Shortcharge like normal.  If the Yapping Maw is returning to its hole, it will usually not grab Samus.

obstacles.name: Center Thick Bomb Blocks
obstacles.note: The centermost bomb block wall that can be destroyed to open up a new runway.
devNote: FIXME: The room can be broken up further to mix and match power bomb usage with shinesparks, or bluesuits.
This can be done by adding obstacles on either end of this center runway, with a junction on the runway.

reusableRoomwideNotable.name: Gauntlet Entrance Blue SpaceJump
reusableRoomwideNotable.note: This is a series of precise space jumps that clears a path through the room while avoiding the solid walls.

strats.name: Morph Bomb Gauntlet Entrance (Left to Right)
Power Bomb Gauntlet Entrance (Left to Right)
Midair Shinespark
strats.note: Shinespark below the top block or Samus will crash into a solid wall.

strats.name: Low Shinespark
note: Shinespark from the end of the entry runway, just past the down slope.
Samus will crash into the last set of blocks preventing access to the opposite door.

strats.name: Gauntlet Entrance Blue SpaceJump (Left to Right)
note: This is a series of precise jumps to fit between the solid walls while clearing a path through the room.
Breaking the center blocks opens up a runway that can be used to charge a new spark in room.
strats.devNote: TODO: There is a blue SpringBall strat to investigate.

strats.name: Morph Bomb Gauntlet Entrance (Right to Left)
Power Bomb Gauntlet Entrance (Right to Left)
Wait for Acid Shinespark
strats.note: Wait for the acid to clear before moving to shinespark on the other side of the bomb blocks.

strats.name: Gauntlet Entrance Blue SpaceJump (Right to Left)
note: This is a series of precise jumps to fit between the solid walls while clearing a path through the room.
Breaking the center blocks opens up a runway that can be used to charge a new spark in room.
strats.devNote: TODO: There is a blue SpringBall strat to investigate.

strats.note: Using the full runway requires killing the Zebbo.
devNote: FIXME: Running through acid doesn't stop a shinecharge, but does inhibit tapping without gravity.
And the acid frame count may change slightly with speed.

strats.name: Gravity
strats.note: Using the full runway requires killing the Zebbo.

strats.note: This longer runway requires breaking the bomb blocks.

nodes.name: Gauntlet E-Tank Center Junction
nodes.note: A junction in the central part of the room, to the right of obstacle A.

obstacles.name: Vertical Bomb Blocks
obstacles.note: The Bomb blocks to the far right respawn and are excluded from this obstacle. The shot blocks are excluded because they are shot blocks.

obstacles.name: Runway Thick Bomb Blocks
obstacles.note: The leftmost thick wall that can be broken for passage or to extend the runway.

farmCycles.name: Shoot and jump three tiles away

strats.name: Shinespark Entry
strats.note: Enter through the top of the door to reach all the way to the shot block wall.

strats.name: Shinespark in Room
strats.note: Avoid or kill the bug, then Midair Shinespark to make it all the way to the shot blocks.

strats.name: Morph Bomb Gauntlet E-Tank Room (Left to Right)

obstacles.devNote: energy requirements are not included, because you can always backtrack to the farm fairly easily.

strats.name: Power Bomb Gauntlet E-Tank Room (Left to Right)

obstacles.devNote: Breaking B with speed only affects power bomb ammo.  Acid damage can be recovered after at the farm.

strats.name: Base
strats.devNote: A Back-of-Gauntlet-Spark strat would require at least Screw Attack and acid Frames to be reasonable.

strats.name: Morph Bomb Gauntlet E-Tank Room (Right to Left)
note: After destroying a single bomb block, Samus can spin jump into its spot to quickly escape the acid.
To avoid the acid completely, morph quickly at the right height and place a bomb.

strats.name: Power Bomb Gauntlet E-Tank Room (Right to Left)
